mdRecord.dcterms:title: Agricultural and geological map of Tennessee: showing also topographical features, as well as railroads, county boundaries, county towns, &c / to accompany the reports of the Bureau of Agriculture, prepared by order of the Bureau by Jas. M. Safford
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Safford, James M. (James Merrill), 1822-1907
Taintor Brothers.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Color-coded for geologic formations matched to lands, soils, crops, etc.
Shows railroads, including incomplete and proposed lines.

Cross sections: Section across the valley of East Tennessee from Cumberland tableland to Unaka -- A geological section from the Mississippi River through Dyer County, Nashville, Sparta, Kingston, Knoxville, Newport, Paint Rock to the Warm Springs in North Carolina.
Inset: The Well's Creek Basin in Stewart County.
Relief shown by hachures and spot heights.
Appeared in: Introduction to the resources of Tennessee / by J.B. Killebrew, assisted by J.M. Safford ... Nashville, Tennessee Bureau of Agriculture, 1874.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Geology--Tennessee--Maps.
Agriculture--Tennessee--Maps.
Mines and mineral resources--Tennessee--Maps.
Tennessee--Maps.
mdRecord.dcterms:spatial: New York (City), New York (State), United States
